required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Virgin Coconut Oil as Adjunctive Therapy for Hospitalized COVID-19 Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Virgin Coconut Oil as Adjunctive Therapy for Hospitalized COVID-19 Patients

collaborator.agency: Philippine Council for Health Research & Development

brief_summary.textblock: This is a research that will investigate the safety and efficacy of virgin coconut oil (VCO) as an adjunctive therapy for Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19)

detailed_description.textblock:
This study will be a randomized controlled trial among hospitalized COVID-19 patients, aged 18 years old and above, admitted at the Philippine General hospital. Patients will be grouped into the following:
1. Group receiving standard of care
2. Group receiving standard of care plus virgin coconut oil (15ml, 3x/day for 2 weeks) as adjunctive therapy.
Patients will be observed as regards to primary outcomes such as recovery/resolution of symptoms and duration of hospital stay

primary_outcome.description: To determine if the VCO intervention can lessen the duration of stay in the hospital by at least 2 days
Patient will be assessed based on the following secondary outcome: time interval before ventilation, ICU and negative results on PCR swab test

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to first receipt of ventilation and admission to intensive care unit
secondary_outcome.description: monitor the duration by which symptoms progress to a point where patient may need intensive care unit admission and/or use of ventilation machine after onsent of VCO administration

Peripheral blood (at most 5mL) will be collected from each patient at baseline, and every week thereafter until the end of study participation for secondary outcome emasurement (CD4+ cells). Blood extraction will coincide with blood collection for routine diagnostic workup of the patient. Laboratory results of other outcome parameters (ie IL6, CRP, ferritin, LDH) will be extracted from patient medical records (as aprt of routine work-up) or from patient database

Peripheral blood (at most 5mL) will be collected from each patient at baseline, and every week thereafter until the end of study participation for secondary outcome emasurement (CD4+ cells). Blood extraction will coincide with blood collection for routine diagnostic workup of the patient. Laboratory results of other outcome parameters (ie IL6, CRP, ferritin, LDH) will be extracted from patient medical records (as aprt of routine work-up) or from patient database

other_outcome.measure: Negative test result for COVID by RT-PCR
other_outcome.description: Negative test result for COVID by RT-PCR (within 3 days after the two week administration of VCO)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Standard of care plus adjunctive virgin coconut oil supplementation
arm_group.description: Standard of care plus virgin coconut oil

intervention.description: Oral supplementation of virgin coconut oil to COVID-19 patients
intervention.arm_group_label: Standard of care plus adjunctive virgin coconut oil supplementation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- symptomatic and asymptomatic COVID-19 hospitalized patients
- has laboratory-confirmed illness during the time of recruitment
- able to take food and medicines enterally
Exclusion Criteria:
- uncontrolled or newly diagnosed diabetes mellitus
- with chronic heart disease
- having elevated lipid profile at baseline (admission)
